definition: beauty/belle
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
mermaid
honey trap/sexual entrapment/CL:條|条[tiao2]
canna or Indian shot (genus Canna)
Sleeping Beauty
a beauty in the bud
widow's peak (in China, regarded as attractive in women)
(Tw) (coll.) edible stem of Manchurian wild rice 菰[gu1], aka water bamboo
even heroes have a weakness for the charms of a beautiful woman (idiom)
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 nan2 guo4 mei3 ren2 guan1

sentences.english: Beauty fit to ornament those ancient manors.
sentences.chinese: 适于装饰那些古老的庄园的美人。

sentences.english: Reading an article is just like appreciating a beauty.
sentences.chinese: 品读一篇文章就像品味一位美人。

sentences.english: And their home, also resembling is boudoir beauty, see inaccessibly .
sentences.chinese: 而他们的家，也像是深闺美人，难得一见。

sentences.english: Should be a beauty on the hero's love, right?
sentences.chinese: 应当是一位美人对英雄的爱慕吧？

sentences.english: None but the bold deserves the fair.
sentences.chinese: 只有强人才配得上美人。

sentences.english: Guangzhou is a beautiful city, but it's too hot in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 狭州是个美人的乡市，但便是夏地太冷了。

sentences.english: Orioles are singing under the beauty pine.
Do you like The Beauty and the Bold ?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢《美人与冒失鬼》吗？

sentences.english: I have been caressing and kissing that thing for almost 2 years because I thought it was a beauty mark.
sentences.chinese: 恶啊，姐一直以为那是个美人痣，又摸又亲了2年啊。

sentences.english: Chinese poets often compare beautiful women to peach blossoms in spring.
sentences.chinese: 中国诗人常将美人比作春天的桃花。

sentences.english: Gold and silver 1've not got, my fair lady.
sentences.chinese: 我没有金和银，我的美人。

sentences.english: Rain Pavilion, beauty of Hosta, so harmonious.
sentences.chinese: 风雨凉亭，美人玉簪，却如此和谐。

sentences.english: Build it up with gold and silver, my fair lady.
sentences.chinese: 用金和银来建造，我的美人。

sentences.english: Concubine Yang was Emperor Xuanzong's favorite concubine in the Tang Dynasty and she was also one of Four Great Beauties in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃是唐玄宗皇帝的爱妃，也是中国四大美人之一。

sentences.english: The high-ranking Imperial Concubine Yang was a plump beauty in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 杨贵妃的体态充盈，是个唐代的美人。

sentences.english: The child blossomed into a beauty.
sentences.chinese: 那个女孩出落为了一个美人。

definition: lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
a woman of unmatched beauty (idiom)
beauty unmatched in her generation (idiom); woman of peerless elegance/prettiest girl ever
beautiful woman
rarity/rare object/rare person/extraordinarily beautiful woman
beautiful woman
beautiful and alluring/glamorous/gorgeous
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful
(of a woman) remarkably beautiful/stunning
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
good looks/beauty/good-looking
lit. countenance of a flower, face like the moon (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) beautiful
lit. fish sink, goose alights (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. female beauty captivating even the birds and beasts
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
divine fragrance, national grace (idiom); an outstanding beauty
national grace, divine fragrance (idiom); an outstanding beauty
